text: The Gambia is expected to compete at the 2020 Summer Olympics in Tokyo. Originally scheduled to take place from 24 July to 9 August 2020, the Games have been postponed to 23 July to 8 August 2021, due to the COVID-19 pandemic. It will be the nation's tenth consecutive appearance at the Summer Olympics since its début at the 1984 Summer Olympics. ==Athletics== Gambian athletes achieved the entry standards, either by qualifying time or by world ranking, in the following track and field events (up to a maximum of 3 athletes in each event): ;Track & road events {| class="wikitable" style="font-size:90%" |- !rowspan="2"|Athlete !rowspan="2"|Event !colspan="2"|Heat !colspan="2"|Semifinal !colspan="2"|Final |-style="font-size:95%" !Result !Rank !Result !Rank !Result !Rank |-align=center |align=left rowspan=2|Gina Bass |align=left|Women's 100 m | | | | | | |-align=center |align=left|Women's 200 m | | | | | | |} ==References== Category:Nations at the 2020 Summer Olympics 2020 Category:2020 in Gambian sport
title: The Gambia at the 2020 Summer Olympics
